title: Facebook declines to take action against Trump statements
text: Twitter responded to the president’s post, which suggested violence against protesters, by hiding it behind a warning label

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg defends leaving up 'inflammatory' Trump posts about Minnesota protests
text: Trump's posts, which included a seeming threat that the National Guard would shoot citizens caught looting, were censored by Twitter. But not by Facebook.

title: Zuckerberg explains why Facebook won’t take action on Trump’s recent posts
text: In a statement posted to Facebook late Friday afternoon, Mark Zuckerberg offered up an explanation of why his company did not contextualize or remove posts from the accounts associated with President Donald Trump that appeared to incite violence against American citizens. “We looked very closely at the post that discussed the protests in Minnesota to […]

title: Zuckerberg finally explains why Facebook is doing nothing about Trump's posts
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg explained Friday night why his company would take no action on posts in which President Trump threatened "looting" in Minneapolis would lead to "shooting." That explanation came roughly 16 hours after Twitter did take action and despite Zuckerberg's having previously told Congeress that posts inciting violence would not be tolerated on Facebook.

title: Mark Zuckerberg says Trump's posts do not violate Facebook policy
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Friday said a post by President Donald Trump in which he says "when the looting starts, the shooting starts" does not violate the company's policies and will remain online.

title: Facebook employees reportedly criticize stance on not fact-checking Trump's posts
text: It follows the president signing an executive order after Twitter labeled and hid tweets it deemed as potentially misleading, and glorifying violence.

title: Big unknown whether tech can be regulated: Goldman's Bellini
text: Heather Bellini, Goldman Sachs lead software and select internet analyst, joins "Squawk on the Street" to discuss the tech space as President Trump rails against social media.

title: Facebook (FB) Up 10.1% Since Last Earnings Report: Can It Continue?
text: Facebook (FB) reported earnings 30 days ago. What's next for the stock?

title: What Does Oculus's $100 Million Milestone Really Mean?
text: VR is still a small player in the technology sphere.

title: Facebook takes on Twitter with Venue, a ‘second screen’ companion for live events
text: Facebook’s R&D group, NPE Team, is launching a new app for engaging fellow fans around live events, Venue. This is the third new app to launch just this week from Facebook’s internal team focused on experimenting with new concepts in social networking.

title: Former US chief technology officer on Trump's social media crack down
text: President Trump signed an executive order on Thursday that seeks to limit some of the federal protections of online companies. The order marks a dramatic escalation in tensions between the White House and some big social media companies as they try to deal with misinformation.

title: The Chaser goes viral with provocative post mocking Zuckerberg’s position on Facebook factchecking
text: Australian comedy team’s deliberately untrue post has been viewed by 1.2 million people in less than 12 hours

title: Trump Signs Executive Order To End Social Media Legal Immunity For Third-Party Content
text: President Donald Trump signed an executive order late Thursday aimed at limiting social media platforms immunity from legal actions arising out of third-party content posted on their platform.
